metadata.name: Arbitrary Shell Command Execution Via Settingcontent-Ms
metadata.comment: The .SettingContent-ms file type was introduced in Windows 10 and allows a user to create "shortcuts" to various Windows 10 setting pages. These files are simply XML and contain paths to various Windows 10 settings binaries.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.settingcontent-ms')) AND NOT contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('immersivecontrolpanel')))

output.summary: The .SettingContent-ms file type was introduced in Windows 10 and allows a user to create "shortcuts" to various Windows 10 setting pages. These files are simply XML and contain paths to various Windows 10 settings binaries.

metadata.objective: Examine fields: ParentProcess, process.cmd_line, process.parent_process.cmd_line False positive: Unknown Reference: https://posts.specterops.io/the-tale-of-settingcontent-ms-files-f1ea253e4d39
